climbs.name: Wrong Way on a One Way

content.description: At first look this line looks like it should be pretty easy but with only low left hand holds and the cramped quarters. High step with your right and throw for the slopey rail.
content.location: Just to the left of bears den in the super slab area.

content.description: This boulder problem starts with your left hand in a crack on the left side of the arete and your right hand on the obvious jug on the right side of the arete. from there make your way up the boulder on balancy moves and top out at the peak of the arete. fun and beautifully located.
content.protection: at least 2 pads. Before climbing double check that the landing zone that has been built up is stable.
content.location: Just 30 yards directly down the slant boulder field from sticky icky.

content.description: Start with both hands matched on the sharp arete, traverse right through the cave and top out through a hole about 10' over.Â
Up the middle of this overhanging face.  Start as low as you can with absurdly high foot, and crimp your way painfully to the top.  Starts in the pit.
content.location: About 150 yards downhill from Moj, and slightly south.  In the middle of the talus.

content.description: SDS near right side of steep face.  Crank up and out on steep lip to top-out.
content.location: This is a steep little boulder just behind Wrong way on a one way, in the middle of the Slant talus field.

content.description:
Climb up the corner coming out a pit.  There's a nice undercling down low that would be cool to start on but it's a bit cramped and there are 0 feet.  We started matched on the next hold (see photo) 

  It could use some serious brush work on all the lichen.  I lost our brush in the deep chasm beneath the boulder.
content.protection: a pad works well to protect the slanted boulder coming up beneath you
content.location: In the talus beneath Super Slab.  Faces NE.

content.description: Start low with good side pulls, paste feet and work your way up featured boulder.  Lots of good movement on this one.
content.location: On the Cheese boulder, left around the corner from Brie.

content.description: On the left side of this boulder.  Interesting start holds, a left hand pinch and good right crimp.  Trick your way up the face on bad feet and small holds.
content.location: left side of the cheese boulder, see photo on main Super Slab area page

content.description: Start on right side of overhang on good ledges and side-pull, traverse out left to slopey but positive holds and finish up on left side of boulder.  Really fun problem with interesting heel hooks and foot swinging action.
content.location: This is kind of hidden because it is in a cave sandwiched between boulders, but try this:     Hike straight down hill from the Super Slab area about 50 to 75ft.  This boulder sits among a cluster of good sized blocks right in the middle of the Slant boulder field.  The Green Corner is just north of this problem by about 10ft.

content.description: Open and sunny in the morning.  The shade comes around 3pm.
